core_scenarios.description: The scenarios where we evaluate all the models.

targeted_evaluations.description: Targeted evaluation of specific skills (e.g., knowledge, reasoning) and risks (e.g., disinformation, memorization/copyright).

question_answering.description: In question answering, given a question and (optionally, in open-book settings) a passage, the goal is to produce the answer. QA is a general format that captures a wide range of tasks involving varying levels of world and commonsense knowledge and reasoning abilities.

information_retrieval.description: In information retrieval, given a query and a set of candidate documents, the goal is to produce a ranking of the documents.

summarization.description: In text summarization, given a piece of text (paragraph or document), the goal is to produce a much shorter summary.

sentiment_analysis.description: In sentiment classification, given a text (e.g., movie review), the goal is to predict the sentiment (positive or negative).

toxicity_detection.description: In toxicity detection, given a text, the goal is to predict whether the text has toxic content.

miscellaneous_text_classification.description: Text classification is a general format that aims to classify text into a set of categories. This includes a wide range of classification tasks where the input is text.

knowledge.description: Targeted evaluation of knowledge (e.g. factual, cultural, commonsense).

reasoning.description: Targeted evaluation of reasoning capabilities (e.g. mathematical, hierarchical).

harms.description: Targeted evaluation of social harms (e.g., copyright, disinformation, social bias, toxicity).

efficiency.description: Targeted evaluation of training and inference efficiency.

ablation_in_context.description: Vary the number of in-context training examples.

ablation_multiple_choice.description: Vary the adapation strategy for multiple-choice questions.

ablation_prompts.description: Vary the instructions and labels for input/output.

robustness_individual.display_name: Robustness to single types of perturbations
robustness_individual.description: Evaluating robsustness to a single perturbation at a time (e.g., typos, synonyms)

boolq.description: The BoolQ benchmark for binary (yes/no) question answering [(Clark et al., 2019)](https://aclanthology.org/N19-1300/).

taxonomy.what: passages from Wikipedia, questions from search queries

narrative_qa.description: The NarrativeQA benchmark for reading comprehension over narratives [(Kočiský et al., 2017)](https://aclanthology.org/Q18-1023/).

taxonomy.what: passages are books and movie scripts, questions are unknown

natural_qa_closedbook.description: The NaturalQuestions [(Kwiatkowski et al., 2019)](https://aclanthology.org/Q19-1026/) benchmark for question answering based on naturally-occurring queries through Google Search. The input does not include the Wikipedia page with the answer.

taxonomy.what: passages from Wikipedia, questions from search queries

natural_qa_openbook_longans.description: The NaturalQuestions [(Kwiatkowski et al., 2019)](https://aclanthology.org/Q19-1026/) benchmark for question answering based on naturally-occurring queries through Google Search. The input includes the Wikipedia page with the answer.

taxonomy.what: passages from Wikipedia, questions from search queries

quac.description: The QuAC benchmark for question answering in the context of dialogues [(Choi et al., 2018)](https://aclanthology.org/D18-1241/).

hellaswag.description: The HellaSwag benchmark for commonsense reasoning in question answering [(Zellers et al., 2019)](https://aclanthology.org/P19-1472/).

openbookqa.description: The OpenbookQA benchmark for commonsense-intensive open book question answering [(Mihaylov et al., 2018)](https://aclanthology.org/D18-1260/).

truthful_qa.description: The TruthfulQA benchmarking for measuring model truthfulness and commonsense knowledge in question answering [(Lin et al., 2022)](https://aclanthology.org/2022.acl-long.229/).

mmlu.description: The Massive Multitask Language Understanding (MMLU) benchmark for knowledge-intensive question answering across 57 domains [(Hendrycks et al., 2021)](https://openreview.net/forum?id=d7KBjmI3GmQ).

msmarco_regular.description: The MS MARCO benchmark's regular track for passage retrieval in information retrieval [(https://microsoft.github.io/msmarco/)](https://microsoft.github.io/msmarco/).

msmarco_trec.description: The MS MARCO benchmark's deep learning TREC track for passage retrieval in information retrieval [(https://trec.nist.gov)](https://microsoft.github.io/msmarco/).

summarization_cnndm.description: The CNN/DailyMail benchmark for text summarization ([Hermann et al., 2015](https://papers.nips.cc/paper/2015/hash/afdec7005cc9f14302cd0474fd0f3c96-Abstract.html); [Nallapati et al.,2016](https://aclanthology.org/K16-1028/)).

summarization_xsum.description: The XSUM benchmark for text summarization of BBC news articles [(Narayan et al., 2018)](https://aclanthology.org/D18-1206/).

imdb.description: The IMDB benchmark for sentiment analysis in movie review [(Maas et al., 2011)](https://aclanthology.org/P11-1015/).

raft.description: The Real-world annotated few-shot (RAFT) meta-benchmark of 11 real-world text classification tasks [(Alex et al., 2021)](https://datasets-benchmarks-proceedings.neurips.cc/paper/2021/hash/ca46c1b9512a7a8315fa3c5a946e8265-Abstract-round2.html).

civil_comments.description: The CivilComments benchmark for toxicity detection [(Borkan et al., 2019)](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1903.04561.pdf).

ice.description: The International Corpus of English (ICE) drawn from English speakers from various places in the world, initiated by [Greenbaum (1991)](https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/english-today/article/abs/ice-the-international-corpus-of-english/47808205394C538393C3FD8E62E5E701).

the_pile.description: The Pile corpus for measuring lanugage model performance across various domains [(Gao et al., 2020)](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2101.00027.pdf).

twitter_aae.description: The TwitterAAE corpus of [Blodgett et al. (2016)](https://aclanthology.org/D16-1120/) for measuring language model performance in tweets as a function of speaker dialect.

twitter_aae_aa.description: The TwitterAAE corpus of [Blodgett et al. (2016)](https://aclanthology.org/D16-1120/) for measuring language model performance on African-American-aligned Tweets.

twitter_aae_white.description: The TwitterAAE corpus of [Blodgett et al. (2016)](https://aclanthology.org/D16-1120/) for measuring language model performance on White-aligned Tweets.

blimp.display_name: BLiMP (The Benchmark of Linguistic Minimal Pairs for English)
blimp.description: The Benchmark of Linguistic Minimal Pairs for English (BLiMP) for measuring performance on linguistic phenomena using minimal pair design [(Warstadt et al., 2020)](https://aclanthology.org/2020.tacl-1.25/).

wikifact.description: Scenario introduced in this work, inspired by [Petroni et al. (2019)](https://aclanthology.org/D19-1250/), to more extensively test factual knowledge.

taxonomy.what: entity-relation-entity triples in natural language form

babi_qa.description: The bAbI benchmark for measuring understanding and reasoning [(Weston et al., 2015)](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1502.05698.pdf).

dyck_language.description: Scenario testing hierarchical reasoning through the Dyck formal languages [(Suzgun et al., 2019)](https://aclanthology.org/W19-3905/).

numeracy.description: Scenario introduced in this work to test numerical reasoning via symbolic regression.

synthetic_reasoning.description: Synthetic reasoning tasks defined using abstract symbols based on LIME [(Wu et al., 2021)](https://proceedings.mlr.press/v139/wu21c.html).

synthetic_reasoning_natural.description: Synthetic reasoning tasks defined using simple natural language based on LIME [(Wu et al., 2021)](https://proceedings.mlr.press/v139/wu21c.html).

gsm.description: The grade school math word problems dataset (GSM8K) for testing mathematical reasoning on grade-school math problems [(Cobbe et al., 2021)](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2110.14168.pdf).

math_regular.description: The MATH benchmark for measuring mathematical problem solving on competition math problems [(Hendrycks et al., 2021)](https://datasets-benchmarks-proceedings.neurips.cc/paper/2021/hash/be83ab3ecd0db773eb2dc1b0a17836a1-Abstract-round2.html).

math_chain_of_thought.description: The MATH benchmark for measuring mathematical problem solving on competition math problems with chain-of-thoughts style reasoning [(Hendrycks et al., 2021)](https://datasets-benchmarks-proceedings.neurips.cc/paper/2021/hash/be83ab3ecd0db773eb2dc1b0a17836a1-Abstract-round2.html).

code_apps.description: The APPS benchmark for measuring competence on code challenges [(Hendrycks et al., 2021)](https://datasets-benchmarks-proceedings.neurips.cc/paper/2021/hash/c24cd76e1ce41366a4bbe8a49b02a028-Abstract-round2.html).

code_humaneval.description: The HumanEval benchmark for measuring functional correctness for synthesizing programs from docstrings [(Chen et al., 2021)](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2107.03374.pdf).

legal_support.description: Scenario introduced in this work to measure fine-grained legal reasoning through reverse entailment.

lsat_qa.description: The LSAT benchmark for measuring analytical reasoning on the Law School Admission Test (LSAT; [Zhong et al., 2021](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2104.06598.pdf)).

lextreme.description: A Multilingual Legal Benchmark for Natural Language Understanding

lex_glue.description: A Benchmark Dataset for Legal Language Understanding in English

billsum_legal_summarization.description: The BillSum benchmark for legal text summarization ([Kornilova & Eidelmann, 2020](https://aclanthology.org/D19-5406/)).

multilexsum_legal_summarization.description: The MultiLexSum benchmark for legal text summarization ([Shen et al., 2022](https://arxiv.org/abs/2206.10883)).

taxonomy.what: legal text from US civil rights lawsuits

eurlexsum_legal_summarization.description: The EurLexSum benchmark for legal text summarization ([Aumiller et al., 2022](https://arxiv.org/abs/2210.13448)).

entity_data_imputation.description: Scenario from [Mei et al. (2021)](https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/9458712/) that tests the ability to impute missing entities in a data table.

entity_matching.description: Scenario from Magellan [(Konda et al., 2016)](https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.14778/3007263.3007314) that tests the ability to determine if two entities match.

copyright_text.description: Scenario introduced in this work to measure copyright and memorization behavior for books, based off of [Carlini et al. (2021)](https://www.usenix.org/biblio-11958).

copyright_code.description: Scenario introduced in this work to measure copyright and memorization behavior for code, based off of [Carlini et al. (2021)](https://www.usenix.org/biblio-11958).

disinformation_reiteration.description: Scenario from [Buchanan et al. (2021)](https://cset.georgetown.edu/publication/truth-lies-and-automation/) that tests the ability to reiterate disinformation content.

disinformation_wedging.description: Scenario from [Buchanan et al. (2021)](https://cset.georgetown.edu/publication/truth-lies-and-automation/) that tests the ability to generate divisive and wedging content.

bbq.description: The Bias Benchmark for Question Answering (BBQ) for measuring social bias in question answering in ambiguous and unambigous context [(Parrish et al., 2022)](https://aclanthology.org/2022.findings-acl.165/).

bold.display_name: BOLD (Bias in Open-Ended Language Generation Dataset)
bold.description: The Bias in Open-Ended Language Generation Dataset (BOLD) for measuring biases and toxicity in open-ended language generation [(Dhamala et al., 2021)](https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3442188.3445924).

real_toxicity_prompts.description: The RealToxicityPrompts dataset for measuring toxicity in prompted model generations [(Gehman et al., 2020)](https://aclanthology.org/2020.findings-emnlp.301/).

synthetic_efficiency.description: Scenario introduced in this work to better understand inference runtime performance of various models.

data_to_text_generation.description: Currently, we prioritize user-facing tasks in our core scenarios, but don't implement data-to-text generation. Could be implemented via WebNLG, E2E, ToTTo, etc.

fact_verification.description: Currently, we prioritize user-facing tasks in our core scenarios, but don't implement fact verification. Could be implemented via FEVER.

copywriting.description: Currently, we prioritize user-facing tasks in our core scenarios, but don't implement tasks that have not been historically studied in the NLP research community like (ad) copywriting.

story_generation.description: Currently, we prioritize user-facing tasks in our core scenarios, but don't implement more creative and interactive tasks like story generation.

biomedical_scenarios.description: Currently, we implement scenarios from common domains in NLP research, neglecting various domains where language technologies could provide significant value.

clinical_scenarios.description: Currently, we implement scenarios from common domains in NLP research, neglecting various domains where language technologies could provide significant value.

financial_scenarios.description: Currently, we implement scenarios from common domains in NLP research, neglecting various domains where language technologies could provide significant value.

customer_service_scenarios.description: Currently, we implement scenarios from common domains in NLP research, neglecting various domains where language technologies could provide significant value.

taxonomy.what: Customer service text (e.g., customer service chat logs)

educational_scenarios.description: Currently, we implement scenarios from common domains in NLP research, neglecting various domains where language technologies could provide significant value.

taxonomy.what: Text from educational contexts (e.g., student-teacher interactions)

very_recent_scenarios.description: Currently, we implement scenarios using standard NLP datasets. However, to test temporal generalization as the world and language change, we should implement scenarios with very recent data (e.g., current world events) like StreamingQA.

historical_scenarios.description: Currently, we implement scenarios using standard NLP datasets, which predominantly are from post-Internet and contemporary society. However, to test temporal generalization for using models in the digital humanities for historic data, we should implement scenarios with significantly older data (e.g., text from 1800s).

not_native_English_speaker.description: Currently, we implement scenarios of an unknown composition of native and non-native English speakers. We should implement scenarios to ensure coverage of language from non-native English speakers.

non_US_demographics.display_name: Scenarios involving data from marginalized demographics in non-US English-speaking regions
non_US_demographics.description: Currently, we ensure some coverage of language based on US-centric demographic groups, including marginalized groups. We should implement scenarios to ensure coverage of other socially-relevant groups beyond US demographics (e.g., caste in India).

taxonomy.who: relevant demographics in non-US English-speaking regions

non_english.description: Currently, we only implement English scenarios.

user_facing_tasks_english_dialects.display_name: Scenarios with user-facing tasks on English dialects
user_facing_tasks_english_dialects.description: Currently, evaluate performance on English dialects via language modeling (e.g., TwitterAAE, ICE), but it would be good to implement user-facing tasks for these dialects.
